column1: This is a list of traditional Arabic place names.  This list includes:
Places involved in the history of the Arab world and the Arabic names given to them.
Places whose official names include an Arabic form.
Places whose names originate from the Arabic language.All names are in Standard Arabic and academically transliterated.  Most of these names are used in modern times
column2: but many of these Arabic forms are not in active use in their namesake places—indeed
column3: modern Arabic names for the same places have often changed to reflect and respect the place's modern non-Arabic pronunciation.

column1: أبو ظبي ʼAbū Ẓaby. Abu Dhabi
أبو غريب ʼAbū Ġurayb.  Abu Ghraib
أبو قير ʼAbū Qīr. Abu Qir
إرتريّا ʼIritriyyā.  Eritrea actually derived from Greek ερυθρος
column2: red (location next to the Red Sea).

column4: as are all the other names derived from Alexander the Great
